文献ID: STP1597-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_18th Volume_008_chunk1
证据片段: Neutron irradiation seems to have little effect on promoting fast oxidation or dissolution of $\beta$ -niobium precipitates but encourages the dissolution of iron from Laves-phase precipitates

文献ID: STP1597-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_18th Volume_008_chunk1
证据片段: An electron energy-loss spectroscopy (EELS) analysis of the oxidation state of niobium in $\beta$ -niobium SPPs in the oxide revealed the fully oxidized ${ \mathsf { N b } } ^ { 5 + }$ state in SPPs deep into the oxide but ${ \mathsf { N b } } ^ { 2 + }$ in crystalline SPPs near the metal-oxide interface

文献ID: STP1597-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_18th Volume_008_chunk1
证据片段: Porosity in the oxide had a major influence on the overall rate of oxidation, and there was more porosity in the rapidly oxidizing annealed Zr-1.oNb alloy than in either the recrystallized alloy or the similar alloy exposed to neutron irradiation

文献ID: STP1597-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_18th Volume_008_chunk1
证据片段: Porosity in the oxide had a major influence on the overall rate of oxidation, and there was more porosity in the rapidly oxidizing annealed Zr-1.oNb alloy than in either the recrystallized alloy or the similar alloy exposed to neutron irradiation

证据片段: oxidation of zirconium alloys at temperatures of $3 0 0 \pm 6 0 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { C }$ in pressurized water

文献ID: STP1597-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_18th Volume_008_chunk1
证据片段: The recent introduction of low-tin zirconium-niobium alloys has resulted in significant improvements in both the corrosion resistance, primarily by delaying the accelerated stage of oxidation (transition), and reductions in the level of HPU

文献ID: STP1597-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_18th Volume_008_chunk2
证据片段: The ZIRLO transition point was between 120 and 135 days.

文献ID: STP1597-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_18th Volume_008_chunk2
证据片段: A few small samples were received of $\mathrm { Z r - 1 . 0 N b }$ sheet coupons irradiated for 1 cycle (540 days) in the Vogtle reactor.

文献ID: STP1597-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_18th Volume_008_chunk2
证据片段: Two TEM lamellae were prepared at a size of approximately 10 by 10 by $2 \mu \mathrm { m }$

文献ID: STP1597-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_18th Volume_008_chunk3
证据片段: For recrystallized $\mathrm { Z r - 1 . 0 N b }$ alloys, six samples were chosen for detailed study. The 3-day sample represented the very beginning of the corrosion process at which the sample had a very fast oxidation rate.

文献ID: STP1597-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_18th Volume_008_chunk3
证据片段: The 120-day sample (not shown) represented the early stage of oxidation with an average oxide thickness of $2 . 2 ~ \mu \mathrm { m }$

文献ID: STP1597-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_18th Volume_008_chunk3
证据片段: The 225-day sample (also not shown) represented a stage before the first transition when the oxide had grown to approximately $2 . 5 { - } 2 . 7 ~ \mu \mathrm { m }$

文献ID: STP1597-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_18th Volume_008_chunk3
证据片段: The 360-day sample was taken at approximately the first transition, and the oxide thickness grew to approximately $3 . 2 ~ \mu \mathrm { m }$ (Fig. 2b-1)

文献ID: STP1597-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_18th Volume_008_chunk3
证据片段: The 540-day sample (also not shown) represented the second transition with an average oxide length of $5 . 2 ~ \mu \mathrm { m }$

文献ID: STP1597-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_18th Volume_008_chunk3
证据片段: The 585-day sample was well past the second transition. As seen from the STEM high-angular annual dark-field (STEM HAADF) image in Fig. 2c-1, after the second layer of cracks, another approximately $9 0 0 ~ \mathrm { { n m } }$ of oxide grew during the 45 days in deuterated water. The oxide thickness was approximately $6 . 1 \ \mu \mathrm { m }$

文献ID: STP1597-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_18th Volume_008_chunk3
证据片段: For the annealed $\mathrm { Z r - 1 . 0 N b }$ alloys, four samples were chosen for detailed study.

文献ID: STP1597-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_18th Volume_008_chunk3
证据片段: The 3-day sample represented the early stage of oxidation (Fig. 2a-1), and the oxide thickness ranged from 0.5 to $0 . 9 ~ { \mu \mathrm { m } }$
